ARABIC: يَٰصَىٰحِبَىِ ٱلسِّجْنِ ءَأَرْبَابٌ مُّتَفَرِّقُونَ خَيْرٌ أَمِ ٱللَّهُ ٱلْوَٰحِدُ ٱلْقَهَّارُ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: My fellow-prisoners, are many lords better, or Allah, the only One, the Conqueror?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: (Tell me) O fellow-prisoners, are a number of gods better, or one God omnipotent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Fellow-prisoners! Is it better that there be diverse lords, or just Allah, the One, the Irresistible?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: My fellow-prisoners can many different masters be considered better than One All-dominant God?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: “O both my fellow-prisoners! Are various lords better, or One Allah, the Dominant above all?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: O two companions of the prison! Are many different lords (gods) better or Allah, the One, the Irresistible"
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: O my two mates of the prison! are sundry lords better or Allah the One, the Supreme?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Say, which is better, my fellow-prisoners -- many gods at variance, or God the One, the Omnipotent?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: O my fellow-prisoners! Are divers lords better, or Allah the One, Almighty?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: O my two fellow-prisoners! Are many diverse lords better, or God, the One, the Almighty?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: O My two fellow-prisoners! are sundry lords better of Allah, the One, the Subduer
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: O my prison mates! Are different masters better, or Allah, the One, the All-paramount?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: O my two companions of the prison! (I ask you): are many lords differing among themselves better, or the One Allah, Supreme and Irresistible?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: O two companions of the prison! Are many different lords (gods) better or Allah, the One, the Irresistible?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: My fellowprisoners, say which is better, many gods at variance, or Allah the One, the Conqueror?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: “O My fellow inmates, are diverse lords better, or God, the One, the Supreme?”
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: O [my] two companions of prison, are separate lords better or Allah, the One, the Prevailing?
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [12:39] He [Joseph] then explicitly calls them to faith, saying: O my two fellow-prisoners!, inmates [of the prison]: Are several lords better, or, is, God, the One, the Almighty, better? (an interrogative meant as an affirmative).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (0 my two fellow prisoners!) He said this to the prison master as well as to the prisoners (Are diverse lords better) is the worship of numerous gods better, (or Allah the One, the Almighty?) or the worship of Allah, the One Who has no son or partner, the All-Conquering over His created beings.
